verses.text: 在安息日，耶穌進了一個法利賽人領袖的家裡吃飯，眾人都在窺探他。

words.note: Lit. 'rest day'.
Pharisee (transliteration) + person.

verses.text: 正好在他面前有一個患水臌病的人；

words.note: Refers to a medical condition mentioned in the Bible.

verses.text: 耶穌對律法師和法利賽人說：「在安息日治病，可以不可以呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'law master'.
Pharisee (transliteration) + person.
Lit. 'rest day'.

verses.text: 他們卻不出聲。耶穌扶著病人，治好他，叫他走了，

words.definition: to tell, to make (someone do sth)

verses.text: 就對他們說：「你們中間誰的兒子或牛在安息日掉在井裡，不立刻把他拉上來呢？」

words.note: Lit. 'rest day'.

words.definition: he, him (referring to son or ox)

verses.text: 他們不能回答這些話。
耶穌看見被邀請的客人選擇高位，就用比喻對他們說：

words.note: Common in biblical context for Jesus' parables.

verses.heading: On Seeking Seats of Honor

verses.text: 「你被邀請參加婚筵的時候，不要自己坐在高位上，恐怕有比你更尊貴的客人也被請來；
那請你又請他的人過來對你說：『請你讓位給這個人。』那時你就慚愧地退居末位了。

words.note: Connects an adjective to a verb to form an adverbial phrase.

verses.text: 你被邀請的時候，要坐在末位上，等請你的人過來對你說：『朋友，請上座。』那時你在同席的人面前才有光彩。

words.note: Here used as a direct address, like 'friend' or 'my friend'.
Meaning 'please ascend to a seat of honor'.
Refers to a sense of glory or face.

verses.text: 因為凡高抬自己的，必要降卑；自己謙卑的，必要升高。」

words.note: Lit. 'lower oneself'
Lit. 'rise high'

verses.text: 耶穌又對邀請他的人說：「你設午餐或晚宴，不要請你的朋友、弟兄、親戚或富裕的鄰舍，恐怕他又回請你，你就得了報答。

words.note: More formal than just 'dinner'
Often refers to fellow believers in biblical context
More formal than 鄰居 (línjū)

verses.text: 你擺筵席的時候，總要邀請那貧窮的、殘廢的、瘸腿的、瞎眼的，

words.note: More formal and traditional term for feast

verses.text: 那你就有福了。因為他們沒有甚麼可以報答你，義人復活的時候，你必定得著報答。」
一起吃飯的人中有一個，聽了這些話，就對耶穌說：「在 神的國裡吃飯的人有福了。」

words.note: The preceding space is a reverence marker, often used in Chinese Bibles.

verses.heading: The Parable of the Great Banquet

verses.text: 耶穌對他說：「有一個人大擺筵席，請了許多客人。

words.definition: to put on a grand display

words.note: Often used in religious contexts for feasts.

verses.text: 到了開席的時候，他打發僕人去對所請的人說：『請來吧！樣樣都準備好了。』

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning 'to begin a meal/feast'.
Commonly used in older texts and biblical contexts.
A particle used to form a noun phrase from a verb.

verses.text: 眾人一致推辭，頭一個說：『我買了一塊地，不得不去看一看，請原諒我。』

words.note: Combined with '不' later to form 'cannot but/must'.
Combined with '不得' to mean 'must'.
Repetition of verb indicates a brief or casual action.

verses.text: 另一個說：『我買了五對牛，要去試一試，請原諒我。』

words.note: Repetition of verb indicates a brief or casual action.

verses.text: 又一個說：『我剛結了婚，不能去。』

words.note: Verb-object compound, with '了' marking completion.

verses.text: 僕人回來把這些事告訴他主人，家主就發怒，對僕人說：『快到城裡大街小巷去，把貧窮的、殘廢的、瞎眼的、瘸腿的，都領到這裡來。』

words.note: Refers to the head of a household or landlord.
Idiomatic expression meaning 'everywhere in the city'.
The particle '的' nominalizes the adjective '貧窮' (poor).
The particle '的' nominalizes the adjective '殘廢' (crippled).
The particle '的' nominalizes the adjective '瞎眼' (blind).
The particle '的' nominalizes the adjective '瘸腿' (lame).

verses.text: 僕人說：『主啊，你所吩咐的已經辦了，還有空位。』

words.note: Indicates the following verb is part of a nominalized or passive clause.
Turns the preceding clause into a noun phrase, 'what you commanded'.

verses.text: 主人就對僕人說：『你出去到路邊籬畔，勉強人進來，好把我的屋子坐滿。

words.note: Often paired with 路邊 meaning 'roadsides and fences'.
Verb-complement construction: 'sit to full'.

verses.text: 我告訴你們，先前請的那些人，一個也不得嘗我的筵席。』」

words.note: Nominalizes the preceding clause 'those previously invited'.
In biblical Chinese, often means 'can' or 'may'.
Refers to a formal dinner or feast.

verses.text: 有許多人與耶穌同行，他轉身對他們說：
verses.heading: Counting the Cost

verses.text: 「如果有人到我這裡來，愛我不超過愛（「愛我不超過愛」原文作「不恨」）自己的父母、妻子、兒女、兄弟、姊妹，甚至自己的性命，就不能作我的門徒。

words.note: Lit. 'gate follower', referring to a student who enters a master's gate.

verses.text: 凡不背著自己的十字架跟隨我的，也不能作我的門徒。

words.note: Often used to introduce a general condition: 'whoever'.
Lit. 'cross-shaped frame'.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding clause, meaning 'the one who...'

verses.text: 你們當中有誰要蓋一座樓，不先坐下計算費用，能不能蓋成呢？

words.definition: to want, to be about to

words.note: Verb + 结果补语(result complement) indicating successful completion.

verses.text: 恐怕安了地基，而不能完成，所有看見的人都譏笑他，
說：『這個人開了工，卻不能完工。』

words.note: `開工` is a verb-object compound, `了` indicates completion.

verses.text: 或者一個王去和別的王打仗，哪有不先坐下想想，能否用一萬兵去抵抗那領兩萬來攻打他的呢？

words.note: Rhetorical question indicating impossibility.
Reduplication indicates 'to do something a bit' or 'to try'.
Indicates purpose or direction of action.
Indicates direction towards the speaker or subject.

verses.text: 如果不能，就該趁對方還遠的時候，派使者去談判和平的條件。
這樣，你們中間不論誰，如果不撇下一切所有的，就不能作我的門徒。

words.note: Often used in biblical context for renunciation.
Turns 'all that one has' into a noun phrase.

verses.text: 「鹽本來是好的，但如果失了味，怎能使它再鹹呢？

words.note: Rhetorical question, implying 'it cannot'.

verses.text: 或用在田裡，或放在糞裡，都不合適；只好扔在外面。有耳可聽的，就應當聽。」

words.note: Turns 'can hear' into 'those who can hear'.
